column4: My /tmp directory is getting cluttered. Is it safe to set my machine to empty /tmp on shutdown?
Dont know. Where would I find that option?
Actually, it's done on boot, if I remember correctly.
I have just rebooted and /tmp has not been emptied. Would it be dangerous to set it up to do that

Actually I say it has not been emptied. It is more correct to say it is not empty, but I notice one file that was there has gone so maybe it was emptied and the other files have been newly written. I just checked the dates on the files and they are all after the reboot
du -hs directory; echo $(find directory -type d | wc -l) directories; echo $(find directory -type f | wc -l) regular files; and so on.
Firefox bookmarks? Just copy the entire ~/.mozilla directory, it'll "import" everything.
As for IRC accounts, that depends on your IRC client.
come on, 7 millibits isn't that much.
and JordanC: I was using pidgin but now Karmic uses Empathy. There is some migration wizard but I dont know how to start it
If you want to continue using Pidgin -- there are instructions at http://pidgin.im/download/ubuntu, and your settings are in ~/.purple/
I don't know about anything related to Empathy migration, sorry. (I'd stay with Pidgin, personally.)
Yes but I need to find what you and jordan told me about it earlier!
If you're talking about ~/.purple -- open your homedir's backup, enable "Show Hidden Files", and look for a directory named ".purple"
Zeroconf is a very different thing from samba/nfs. It's used for different purposes.
